objective: Calculate the number of residents owning at least one of the three items: diamond ring, golf clubs, or garden spade using the inclusion-exclusion principle.
supporting_info: This subtask relies on the overall count of residents owning specific items, applying mathematical principles to find the total ownership of at least one item.

objective: Determine the number of residents owning exactly two of the three items based on the output of subtask 1 and the provided data.
supporting_info: This analysis hinges on the results from subtask 1 to segment the residents according to ownership, necessitating a clear distinction of ownership data.

objective: Calculate the number of residents owning exactly three of the three items using the findings from subtasks 1 and 2.
supporting_info: Utilizes the outcomes from previous subtasks to derive a precise count of residents owning multiple items, forming a foundation for subsequent calculations.

objective: Calculate the number of residents owning all four items, including the bag of candy hearts, using the outputs of the initial three subtasks.
supporting_info: This final analysis integrates and reflects on all previous outputs to ensure an accurate determination of those owning all specified items.
